schema.name: Kangkong In Coconut Cream
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the water spinach thoroughly under cold water.
Peel and mince the garlic, then peel and finely chop the red onion.
In a pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat and sauté the garlic and onion until they're softened and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the water spinach to the pan, cook for 5 minutes until it begins to wilt.
Pour in the coconut cream, add salt and black pepper. Stir well to combine and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve the kangkong hot, optionally garnished with some finely chopped red pepper for color and a slight spicy kick.

schema.description: Indulge in the essence of health and flavor with our Kangkong In Coconut Cream recipe. Perfect for those following a low-carb and low-sugar lifestyle, this dish combines the nutritional goodness of water spinach with the rich, creamy texture of coconut cream. Tailored for the health-conscious, this recipe promises to be a delightful addition to your healthy eating habits.
